_header: Saint Brice with Saint Martin was his deacon on earth here
Subjects: saints’ lives; Brice, saint, life of
_description: Life of St. Brice in the South English Legendary — couplets

BodAsh43.First Lines:
SEyn brice wiþ seynt martin was is dekene anerþe hereTo
                    seynt martyn he was contrarious In eche manere…
BodAsh43.Last Lines:
…Nou god uor þe gret a[ ] þat seynt brice hadde
                    hereGrante ous to be vor is loue of pyne of helle skere

Bod779.First Lines:
sein bryse wit seint martin was erchedekin hereto his lord seint
                    martin he was contrarius in ech manere…
Bod779.Last Lines:
…Now god for þe gret anoy þat seint bryse had
                    heregrant vs for his loue of þe pyne of helle be skere

CULAdd3039.First Lines:
Sayne Brice with sayne Martyn was his deken als we redeOft he
                    scorned his awen lorde & conturried his dedeA pore man mett with sayne
                    brice als þai wente to a plasAnd spired after sayne martyne þat
                    his lorde was…
CULAdd3039.Last Lines:
…Now Llord for þat sakles shame þat sayne Brice suffrede
                    hereGraunte vs to be for his lufe in heuene þat is so
                    clere

CamFitzMc128.First Lines:
SAint Brice with saint martin was his dekyn on erth herTo his lord
                    saint martyn contrarios he was in ych maner…
CamFitzMc128.Last Lines:
…Now Ihesu for the mykel any that saint Brice had herGraunt vs
                    to be for his love of the pyn of helle skere

CamMagPep2344.First Lines:
Seint Brice wiþ Seint Martin was his deokne on eorþe
                    hereTo Seint Martin his lord he was contrarious in eche
                    manere…
CamMagPep2344.Last Lines:
…Now god ffor þe grete anuy þat Seint Brice hadde
                    hereGraunte vs to beo ffor his loue of þe pyne of helle
                    skere

CamTCC605.First Lines:
SEint bryce was erchedeken myd seint martyn hereTo seint Martyn he
                    was contraryous in eche manere…
CamTCC605.Last Lines:
…now god for þe grete anuye þat seint bryce hadde
                    þergraunte for his loue to be of þe pyne of helle
                    skere

BLCottJulDIX.First Lines: SEin brice wit sein martin was his dekne an erþe hereto sein martin his lord he was quarious in eche manere…
BLCottJulDIX.Last Lines: …nou lord for þe grete anuy þat sein brice hadde þeregraunte ous to be for his loue of þe pine of helle skere
BLCottJulDIX.Note: “Capitulum lxxix” added to right margin by later hand (f. 177).
BLCottJulDIX.Facsimiles:
Digital Facsimile of British Library  Cotton Julius MS D IX.

BLEge2810.First Lines: SEint brice wiþ seint martin was his dekene anerþe hereTo Seint martin he was contrarious in eche manere…
BLEge2810.Last Lines: …Nou louird vor þe grete anuy þat seint brice hadde hereGraunte ous to be vor is loue of pine of helle skere

BLEge2891.First Lines: SEin brice wiþ sein Martin was is dekne an eorþe hereTo sein Martin he was contrarious is louerd in eche manere…
BLEge2891.Last Lines: …Nou louerd for þe grete anny þat sein brice hadde hereGrante us to beo for is loue of þe pine of helle schere

BLSto949.First Lines: Seyn brice wiþ Seyn martin was ys dekne on erþe hereTo Seyn martyn he was quarius is lord in eche manere…
BLSto949.Last Lines: …Nou god for þe gret anu þat Seyn brice hadde hereGraunt vs to be for is loue of þe pyne of helle schere

Lam223.First Lines:
SAynt Brice with saynt Maryn was his deken on erþe hereTo his
                    lord saynt Martyn he was contrarious in ych manere…
Lam223.Last Lines:
…And dyed þe vij & sixty ȝere þat he was busshop
                    madeNow Ihesu for þe mykel anye þat saynt brice had
                    hereGraunte vs to be for his love of þe pyne of hell skere
                    Amen

TokyoTak54.First Lines:
Seynt Brice wiþ seint Martyn his deken or erþe was
                    hereContrarye he was to seint Martyn his lord in ech
                    manere…
TokyoTak54.Last Lines:
…Now god for þe grete gref þat seint brice hadde
                    hereGraunt vs to be for his loue of helle pyne skere. Amen.
